comments.body: What will happen if the task does not exist?
I now catch the exception in this case and log that the task id wasn't found. Thanks again for all the feedback/help!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +131,135 @@    def execute(self, context: Dict) -> None:
        hook = AsanaHook(conn_id=self.conn_id)
        response = hook.delete_task(self.asana_task_gid)
        self.log.info(response)

comments.body: In the connection you are able to set `workspace` and `project` but the operators doesn't seem to allow to overwrite the default. Does this means that we need to define connection per workspace,project? Should we allow overwrite in the operator level?

Thanks for the comment, I can see how this could be confusing... you actually can override these (where applicable) in the dict used to pass optional Asana configuration parameters to the operator. For example, if you wanted to override the project defined in the connection when using the `AsanaFindTaskOperator`, you could pass `search_parameters={'project': 'some other project'}`. This is then passed to the `find_task` method of the hook, where `_merge_find_task_parameters` gets called and the project passed in through the operator's `search_parameters` will override the default project from the connection if present. I should probably add more documentation to make this clearer, though.
How about Addiding that comment (or even example) in "example_asana.py" @jmelot . I promise that PR will be much faster :rocket:
